intro: Pentanema chodzhakasiani, commonly known as the Chodzhakasi pentanema, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Onagraceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions. Its flowers are usually pink or white, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
